Entry.Name: Logjam
Entry.Description: The TLS protocol 1.2 and earlier, when a DHE_EXPORT ciphersuite is enabled on a server but not on a client, does not properly convey a DHE_EXPORT choice, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to conduct cipher-downgrade attacks by rewriting a ClientHello with DHE replaced by DHE_EXPORT and then rewriting a ServerHello with DHE_EXPORT replaced by DHE, aka the "Logjam" issue.

Mitigation.Textual:
Even if the client are probably fixed, you should disable all TLS Export ciphers server-side.
You can either apply a configuration FIX OR
Deploy (Ephemeral) Elliptic-Curve Diffie-Hellman (ECDHE) OR
Generate a Strong, Unique Diffie Hellman Group OR
update OpenSSL.
Mitigation.Apache:
1. open your Apache configuration file (default: /etc/apache2/sites-available/default-ssl.conf);
2. find the line starting with: SSLCipherSuite;
3. add the string :!EXPORT at the end.

N.B. restart the server by typing: sudo service apache2 restart.
Mitigation.nginx:
1. In a default situation, you can edit your website configuration /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/default
(if you changed your site conf name /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/YOURSITECONFIGURATION);
2. Inside server {...} brackets configuration, find ssl_ciphers;
3. Remove EXPORT (if any) and add :!EXPORT at the end.


N.B. restart the server by typing: sudo service nginx restart.
